title: Data Interpretation and Line Graphs

vocab.definition: A graph that uses lines to show how data changes over time
The general direction or pattern that data shows
The numbers along the sides of a graph that show the values
The equal spaces between numbers on a graph
A pair of numbers that shows the location of a point on a graph
The horizontal axis on a graph
The vertical axis on a graph
How steep a line is; the rate of change
How much a quantity increases or decreases per unit of time
To estimate a value between two known data points

teachingNotes: Teach students how to read and create line graphs. Practice identifying trends and making predictions based on data patterns. Use real-world data like temperature or plant growth.
